thread.title: Science with Chris Smith: Homo Naledi skeletons discovered
thread.title_full: Science with Chris Smith: Homo Naledi skeletons discovered

author: ABC Radio National
title: Science with Chris Smith: Homo Naledi skeletons discovered
text:
Image: A cast of the skull of a new human ancestor, Homo Naledi, in the vault of the University of the Witwatersrand in South Africa (Barcroft Media/Getty Images) 
Overnight, scientists have announced the discovery of 15 skeletons known as Homo Naledi in a cave in South Africa. 
It's estimated that the skeletons could be 2.5 million years old. Indeed, they could be the skeletons that change our understanding of early humans. 
While they have some human features, they also have some features that anthropologists have described as 'primitive' and 'bizarre'. 
With more, Geraldine Doogue is joined by RN Breakfast 's science correspondent, Chris Smith.
